Header.title: Busy Bees Addis
Header.paragraph: Where imagination and joyful learning blossoms!

About.paragraph: Our day care and preschool programs are carefully designed to encourage each child’s growing need for independence and an emerging sense of self while nurturing intellectual, growth, exploration, and socialization in a safe, supportive environment. Our classrooms not only feature a variety of working spaces that encourage small group work and cooperative learning activities, but they also use learning centers that allow children to explore areas that interest them. Each center features skills as language and reading, construction , home living, math, fine and gross motor skills, art, dramatic play, science and sensory exploration. Each area helps your child your child gain independence and further explore themes and concepts introduced in class with a hands-on, interactive approach for child development.
Why: Exploring with letters, language and phonics
Interdisciplinary lessons in STEAM learning (Science, Technology, Art, Math, and Engineering)
Amharic, Geez and French learning centers

Team.name: Emebet Dinku
Team.description: Emebet Dinku, Co-founder of Busy Bees Early Learning School, has a strong passion for education and working with children. With a background in the coffee industry, she brings valuable skills in management and customer service to create a nurturing environment at Busy Bees. Emebet and her team of educators share a vision of unlocking each child's potential. They prioritize safety, inclusivity, and joy in their school, treating every child as their own. Emebet's commitment to education extends beyond Busy Bees; she also serves as the CEO of COMEX Services Plc and the Board Secretary at Women in Coffee Ethiopia (WICA).In her free time, she enjoys movies, music, dancing, and spending time with her puppies.

Team.name: Abdilfetah Yasin
Team.description: Abdi Yassin, Co-founder of Busy Bees Addis, a visionary project aiming to create a remarkable early learning center in Addis Ababa. Currently living in Australia, Abdi brings valuable expertise from his background in education, youth work, and social work to Busy Bees Addis. Our goal is to provide a safe, joyful space for children to play, explore, learn, and socialize. Abdi is committed to upholding high standards and creating an exceptional learning environment. In his free time, Abdi enjoys reading, watching documentaries, hiking, baking, playing games, and practicing taekwondo. With Busy Bees Addis, Abdi will contribute new ideas and ensure the availability of school materials. Let's embark on this exciting journey together, nurturing the growth and happiness of every child we serve.

Team.name: Tsigereda Alemayehu
Team.description: Tsigereda Alemayehu (Hannah) is Managing director/educator and Co-founder  at Busy Bees Addis Early Learning School. She is well experienced and has a strong passion for working with children. She has taught early preschoolers and trained nannies for the past 14 years! She is very passionate when it comes to teaching children and helping them with what they need.   With each of those wonderful and amazing years she believes that she added extra happiness and blessing to her life, Hannah is married and has four handsome boys. She loves spending time with her family, walking, cooking, and giving volunteering service at charity and orphans.

Team.name: Eyassu yemaneberhan
Team.description: Eyassu Yemaneberhan is one of the co-founders of Busy Bees Addis. He is strongly passionate about teaching children. For the past 8 years, he has been teaching preschool.In his free time Eyassu enjoys reading books, occasionally hiking and spending time with his family and friends.

Team.name: Maraki Abebaw
Team.description: Maraki Abebaw, Director of Learning of Busy Bees Addis Early Learning School, has been in the education sector for more than 12 years. She has worked with three years old and has gained experience in the passing years with all early childhood education in various program structures.  Maraki has also worked as a deputy director for four years and has provided leadership and guidance for her team. Teaching is her passion, and she is always ready to explore new ways of teaching to make learning easy for children. In her free time, she loves to create art in her studio and enjoys spending time in nature!

Team.name: Abeba Berhanu
Team.description: Abeba Berhanu is a dedicated veteran teacher with a diverse background in teaching children. She holds a bachelor's degree in psychology and is passionate about helping students achieve their full potential. Abeba is known for her dynamic teaching style and ability to connect with students on a personal level. Her classes are challenging, but also engaging and fun. Her hobbies are listening to music, going to concerts, and travelling.

Team.name: Mekdes Hawazebrhan
Team.description: Mekdes Hawazebrhan is passionate about teaching kids to get to their full potential and for them to be curious about their surroundings. She has her bachelor's degree in psychology from Mekelle university. This is her second year working with kids.  She enjoys spending her spare time reading books, watching movies, listening to music and spending time with her family and friends.

Team.name: Fitsum Ephrem
Team.description: Fitsum Ephrem, an art teacher at Busy Bees Early Learning School, has more than nine years of experience in teaching children. She is also an Artist by profession. Fitsum believes in teaching art to children at their early stage, because it establishes the base for their development in creativity as well as expressing themselves. She has identified the different techniques that are essential to enable the students to be creative as well as enjoy the process. Fitsum and her assistants are committed to making the students self-sufficient in producing their own art. She will take them through a journey of enjoyable practical exercises, by guiding them on how to apply the basics of arts and craft according to their level

Team.name: Worknesh Yasin
Team.description: Worknesh Yasin, primary educator at Busy Bees Early Learning School. She has a BA degree in accounting, and she has been working with infants and toddlers for more than eight years. She is very dedicated to making her children happy and friendly. Seeing the kids doing new things and experiencing their world is truly what she loves to observe from them. Worknesh enjoys engaging in play, interacting and reading with the children. She also loves it when they teach her new things.

Contact.address: D.A.R sahara st, Addis Ababa , Ethiopia

Features.title: Greeting
Features.text: The first thing that greets you when you enter to our school is the office staff. Their actions set the tone for the rest of the school. If the front office is inviting for teachers, parents, and students, then the school leadership values customer service

Features.title: Communication and Parent Involvment
Features.text: Busy Bees Addis truly believes in the importance of staying connected! Our staff communicates daily via email, phone calls, texts and weekly updates parents how their child’s day went. We are active on our website and share every month our activities, events and learning journey. Busy Bees Addis encourages parents to be and active in their child’s learning journey. Our social media pages actively showcases our students learning process every day. Drop by and check us out!

Features.title: Small - Group Setting
Features.text: Busy Bees Addis Early Learning Center offers much smaller teacher/student ratios. Our typical class ratio for age group 6months – 3years is one teacher to every five student. Older students from age 4-6 years old are one teacher to every six student. However, student’s age grouped from 6months – 1 year and half are required to come with their nannies.
